p: This research explored the potential anti-diabetic activity of P. malayana leaf extracts at different methanol-water ratios (0 %, 25 %, 50%, 75 %, and 100% methanol-water). The 100% methanol-water extract showed the maximum inhibitory activity. The correlation of FTIR spectra and AGI activity identified the functional groups that are able to induce AGI activity, namely hydroxyl (O-H), alkenyl (C=C), methylene (C-H), carbonyl (C=O), and secondary amine (N-H) groups. This analysis has developed a validated statistical model, with an R 2Y value of 0.9255 indicating the fitness of the model. The AGI activity of P. malayana was predicted using this validated statistical model. This finding shows that the developed model is statistically valid to predict AGI activity, which is very useful as a tool in the quality control of this plant.
